Direct message the job poster from Walmart Marketplace
Sanjay Bherwani
Senior Recruiter
Are you interested in building and scaling inventory management and forecasting mechanisms for the future of Walmart Fulfillment Services? In this role you will be shaping the future of how WFS manages inventory from end to end. This will include inventory planning, inventory optimization, as well as operational forecasting and execution as WFS manages a network of 20+ fulfillment centers and more site launches to come. The Manager II, Advanced Analytics is a critical thought-leadership role that helps to scale the future of inventory management and forecasting as WFS adds thousands of new sellers and expands to numerous fulfillment and inbound consolidation centers. This role will be responsible for improving inventory health through data modeling and creative problem solving. Additionally, the role will include forecast management and inventory allocation optimization, which will rely on advanced analysis and automation in order to effectively manage on day-to-day basis. This individual will work closely with cross-functional teams including Supply Chain Strategy and Operations, Account Management, Product Management and more. The right candidate must be able to thrive and succeed in a startup environment. This role is built for a creative problem solver with strong analytics and data modeling skills. Communication and storytelling will also be a crucial part of this role as you work with Senior Leadership and other key stakeholders.You’ll sweep us off our feet if…Creative problem solver: someone who can operate with minimal direction. Constantly monitoring the business and identifying opportunities and proposing solutions. Will ask the right questions and think about how to solve the problem with limited resources available. Knowing when to trade off long term outlook for short term wins and vice versa.Model Development: with super strong analytics / data science background and a deep understanding of supply chain, builds and manages part of the development and implementation of data models/ algorithms. Focus on small projects within a business area or category to help to direct proof of concept and prototype, implement algorithms, and track and improve performance.Storytelling with Data: helps to prepare and deliver simple and compelling data driven presentations to communicate analytical stories to cross-functional partners (e.g., software engineering, account management) to gain buy-in and typically present work up to both senior leadership in analytics.Continuous Improvement: develops the framework of performance tracking and drives the continuous improvement of models/algorithms.Collaboration: identifies use cases through cross-functional teams across the organization (e.g., categories, customer support, supply chain operation) and partners with senior leadership in analytics to develop and implement data analysis strategies and anticipate future trends and analysis.You’ll make an impact by:This candidate will make an impact by managing and optimizing inventory health – this includes increasing in-stock % on top of clearing through excess inventory. Responsible for both analysis and strategy development in these key areas. Building scalable strategies & mechanisms that can be implemented and executed across thousands of sellers and 20+ fulfillment centers.Inventory Allocation – managing seller and inventory allocation across a network of numerous fulfillment centers and consolidation centers. Developing and driving the strategy of how to allocate inventory throughout the network in order to reduce cost and increase in stock %.Forecasting – partnering in weekly forecast process for fulfillment centers. Optimizing process as network continues to expand and increased accuracy and automation is required. Manage communication with FC Ops and other key stakeholders.Ops Partnership & Execution – responsible for new site launch and exit strategy and execution. Requires advanced analysis to identify building requirements, inventory transfer opportunities etc. Stakeholder management will be crucial as you execute work across a number of teams.Benefits & Perks:Beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more. About WalmartJoin Walmart and your work could help over 265 million global customers live better every week. Yes, we are the Fortune #1 company. But you’ll quickly find we’re a company who wants you to feel comfortable bringing your whole self to work. A career at Walmart is where the world’s most complex challenges meet a kinder way of life. Our mission spreads far beyond the walls of our stores. Join us and you'll discover why we are a world leader in diversity and inclusion, sustainability, and community involvement. From day one, you’ll be empowered and equipped to do the best work of your life.
